avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanche danger is moderate above 2200m, below that altitude danger is low. Medium-sized slab avalanches can be triggered by one sole skier in a few steep spots above 2200m. If a fracture occurs it can reach down to more deeply embedded layers in the snowpack and the release grow to medium size. The danger zones are difficult to recognize, occur esp. on very steep north-facing slopes. Caution urged esp. above 2500m on E/W facing slopes. Avalanches in the near-surface drifts remain small-sized. During the course of the day, naturally triggered loose-snow avalanches can be expected in extremely steep south-facing terrain. On steep grass-covered slopes, isolated small glide-snow avalanches are possible in isolated cases.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Weak old snowpack layers still prone to natural triggering at high altitudes

snowpackStructure.comment: On shady slopes, 10-20cm of fresh loose snow on the surface, on steep sunny slopes a melt-freeze crust has formed which is often capable of bearing loads. Under that is a melt-freeze crust up to 2400m. Near the crust, faceted crystals have formed. In the lowermost part of the snowpack on shady high-altitude slopes there are several layers of faceted crystals near ground level and elsewhere.

tendency.highlights: On Saturday, fresh snowdrift accumulations will be generated due to intensifying foehn wind

weatherForecast.comment: On Friday, sunshine and good visibility until midday. In the afternoon hours, high-altitude cloud cover will spread from the SW, increasingly hampering sunshine. At high-altitudes in the Tauern, moderate to strong southerly winds. At 2000m. from +2 to +7 degrees; at 3000m. from -2 degrees.

avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanche danger is low. Isolated small loose-snow naturally triggered avalanches are possible or can be triggered by one sole skier. Danger zones for small slab avalanches in the snowdrifts occur seldom on very steep N/E facing slopes at high altitudes. On steep grass-covered slopes, isolated small glide-snow avalanches are possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Danger of falling outweighs that of being buried in snow masses

snowpackStructure.comment: The shallow, generally stable snowpack has consolidated well. About 5-10cm of fresh snow lies atop a melt-freeze crust mostly capable-of-bearing-loads.

tendency.highlights: Avalanche danger levels will increase slightly in the Northern Alps due to intensifying southerly winds.

weatherForecast.comment: On Friday, sunshine and good visibility until midday. In the afternoon hours, high-altitude cloud cover will spread from the SW, increasingly hampering sunshine. At high-altitudes in the Tauern, moderate to strong southerly winds. At 2000m. from +2 to +7 degrees; at 3000m. from -2 degrees.

customData.generalHeadline: Weak old snowpack layers still prone to triggering at high altitudes
